newsitem.title: USA: Los Angeles transit agency reaches labor pact.
newsitem.headline: Los Angeles transit agency reaches labor pact.

text.p: A tentative agreement has been reached on a new labor contract between the Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority and the union representing about 600 clerks, the authority said Friday.

The proposed contract with the Transportation Communications Union includes cost-of-living adjustments and annual base pay increases for all union members. There is also a guarantee of no layoffs, and no reduction in wage rates and benefits for workers over the three-year term of the contract, the authority said in a statement.
The terms of the agreement will be made public after the proposed contract is presented to union members and the authority's board by the end of the month.
A new three-year contract with the United Transportation Union, which represents 4,000 authority bus and train operators, was approved by the authority's board on July 8.
Bargaining talks are continuing between the authority and the Amalgamated Transit Union, which represents 1,700 mechanics and maintenance employees, the authority said.
